title-group.article-title: זכויותיו של ממשכן נכס להבטחת חיובו של אחר
title-group.subtitle: בעקבות ע"א 1691/11 בנק לאומי למשכנתאות בע"מ נ' רחל צוברי מיום 15.12.2015

abstract.p: The Guarantee Law 1967 applies not only to a person who guarantees an obligation of another party, but also to a person who pledges an asset to secure an obligation of another. Section 12 of the Pledge Law 1967 states that such a pledger will be deemed a guarantor (below: "Pledger Guarantor"), and the creditor is only entitled to recover from him by realization of the pledge.

Some years ago, there was a major change in the Guarantee Law that provided wide jus cogens protection to consumer guarantees, which cannot be contracted out of to the detriment of the consumer guarantor. This change created two new kinds of guarantors, when the creditor is: "one who provides loans in the ordinary course of his business". In that case, if the guarantor meets the criterion that is defined in section 19, he can be defined as a "Single Guarantor" that is then entailed to special protections that are determined in sections 21-26; or defined as a "Protected Guarantor" that over and above these protections also have special protections that are determined in sections 27-29.
After the creation of these new types of privileged guarantors, the question whether these changes also apply to the Pledger Guarantor arose, and there were different approaches.
The question was recently raised in the case of "Leumi Mortgage Bank Ltd. V. Tsuberi", and on 15.12.2015 the Supreme Court ruled as follows:
In general, the Pledger Guarantor is entailed to the protections of the Single and Protected Guarantors, if he meets the required criteria. But there are some adjustments that have to be made.

Section 21 determines that the guarantee of a "Single Guarantor" must be for a defined amount, otherwise he will be fully discharged from his guarantee. This section is invalid, because the creditor is entitled to recover from the Pledger Guarantor only by the realization of the pledge, and therefore is inherently limited.

Section 25 determines that the creditor is limited by the extra charges that can add to the capital loan sum. The Supreme Court ruled that this section is also invalid regarding the Pledger Guarantor, for the same reason, that the obligation is inherently limited.
The other special protections, especially the duty of wide disclosure, are valid.

The court didn't examine if the special protections that are given only to "Protected Guarantors" need to be changed when the guarantor is a "Pledger Guarantor". That question will have to be decided in the future.

The Supreme Court also addressed situations of contracts between the bank and a person who pledges an asset to secure an obligation of another, and described that person as a borrower and not as a guarantor, even though the loan was taken out by someone else. The court ruled that in these circumstances, the assumption is that the bank has adopted this path in order to deny that person, the guarantor protection; and that he should be treated as guarantor despite the definition in the contract.

הממשכן נכס להבטחת חיובו של אחר מכונה "ערב ממשכן", "ערב ריאלי" או "ערב חפצי". במאמר זה יכונה "ערב ממשכן".

נספח א' סעיף 1.3 . להוראה. יש לציין כי לעיתים הערב הוא זה שאף משלם בפועל את תשלומי ההלוואה, ואז הוא מכונה על ידי הבנק "ערב משלם".
כאמור, ישנם מלומדים המסכימים עם הגישה הנוטה להחיל את הגנות פרק ב' על הערב הממשכן, וישנם הסבורים אחרת, ראו הערה 4 לעיל.

יצוין כי העמדה לפיה הערב הממשכן אינו זכאי לפטור מערבותו אם גובה החוב לו ערב אינו מוגבל, ננקטה על ידי בית המשפט העליון כבר כאשר דן בשאלת תחולת הוראות המעבר שנחקקו עם תיקון החוק, וחלו על ערבים שחתמו על ערבותם טרם התיקון, ראו פרשת פייבושביץ, הערה 3 לעיל.
